segment_text: Yeah, I was in the boy scouts at the time.
segment_text_rephrased: Indeed, I was part of the boy scouts back then.

segment_text: And we was doing the 50-yard dash,
segment_text_rephrased: We were engaged in a 50-yard sprint,

segment_text: but we was at the pier, marked off,
segment_text_rephrased: yet we were by the dock, with the area demarcated,

segment_text: and so we was doing the 50-yard dash.
segment_text_rephrased: thus we were sprinting the 50 yards.

segment_text: There was about 8 or 9 of us, you know, going down, coming back.
segment_text_rephrased: Around 8 or 9 of us were there, racing forth and back.

segment_text: And, going down the third time, I caught cramps
segment_text_rephrased: On the third run down, I was struck by cramps
and I began to shout for "Help!"

segment_text: but the fellows didn't believe me, you know.
segment_text_rephrased: however, my peers didn't take me seriously, you see.

segment_text: They thought I was just trying to catch up, because I was going on or slowing down.
segment_text_rephrased: They assumed I was merely attempting to make up ground, as I was either advancing or falling behind.

segment_text: So all of them kept going.
And so I started going down.
segment_text_rephrased: And that's when I started to sink.
The Scoutmaster was on the scene.

segment_text: But he didn't pay me no attention either.
segment_text_rephrased: Yet he also disregarded my plight.

segment_text: And for no reason at all there was another guy, who had just walked up that minute...
segment_text_rephrased: Unexpectedly, another individual, who had arrived just at that moment...
